pageContext.claim: “‘The Ukraine controversy continues this morning as new documents obtained by @FoxNews show that a former Ukrainian prosecutor said that he was forced to back off looking into a firm tied to Hunter Biden.’ @MariaBartiromo  Does anyone other than Fake News protectors have a doubt?”
pageContext.analysis: It's astonishing to see Fox News and the president taking Viktor Shokin at his word to denigrate a former U.S. vice president and his son. Shokin was notorious in Ukraine and the international community of Western allies for turning a blind eye to corruption when he was Ukraine's prosecutor general. Shokin was not investigating Burisma Holdings, the natural gas company on whose board Hunter Biden sat for five years, when Joe Biden was pushing for his ouster. In fact, the Western community wanted Shokin out partly because he was not pursuing the Burisma case.
